ISO9660 filesystems are read-only, so the "chmod" command wouldn't have done anything.  that is already executable, they most likely screwed up the shebang line (first line of the script, which tells it how to run)
try specifying a shell to run the script with, e.g.: sudo bash install
I mean "bash ./install"
otherwise it will look in your $PATH for "install"
I get this shiv@shiv-laptop:/media/MathWorks_R14_1$ sudo bash ./install
I am starting from scratch. Can u help me make scripts executable. I am trying this reply #3 http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=149963&highlight=bin+cue
your ISO image is already fine
just go: sudo bash ./install
if that doesn't work, paste me the error message
ok let me see
whats wrong with this command sudo chmod 700 ~/.gnome2/nautilus-scripts/*.*
I just am redoing the scripts again
nothing is wrong with it, except on UNIX filesystems "dots" are not always used, so that should be: ~/.gnome2/nautilus-scripts/*
this is what I am getting shiv@shiv-laptop:/media/MathWorks_R14_1$ sudo bash ./install
okay, so it is telling you not to run it from the CD.  switch to another directory and then run it like: sudo bash /media/MathWorks_R14_1/install
